column4: My card support 3D rendering then why does X not load GLX extension, ?  >>  Xlib:  extension "GLX" missing on display ":0.0".
do you have the appropriate drivers activated?
yes the drivers are correct,
let me paste the Xorg.log output in pastebin
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8514/
checking it out now
can you pastebin the result of the glxinfo command? also have you edited xorg.conf manually and did you get the driver from repo's or website?
any luck with that glx error mate ?
any luck mate ?
did you post answers to the questions i asked? i didn't see it...
khaije:  i got dc'ed, sorry i did not see it. apologies
i just asked if you could pastebin the output to 'glxinfo' and how you installed the drivers

right, http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8515/, i installed the drivers using the article on ubuntu site for nvidia binary driver. I would mention that i had a driver before this which i downloaded from nvidia site and it was giving me grief.

i also found that symlink libGLcore.so.1 was pointing to the old driver /usr/lib/libGLcore.so.1.0.9631 while there is another one now which is /usr/lib/libGLcore.so.1.0.8774 , i am changed the symlink and X has come up, but the resolution is weired, it only now shows 1024x768 as max
the resolution with /usr/lib/libGLcore.so.1.0.9631 is ok, but glx wont load
i hope you got all that info ?
X is not loading GLX extension, my card is NVidia GForce4 440MX, see glx failing in Xorg.log >>
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8517/
please help

i would reccomend (1)using the repo'd nvidia blobs instead of any other ones for simplicity and ease , also (2) purge and reinstall the xserver-xorg-core package , and (3) dist-upgrade if you haven't done that lately
right, trying that now
sorry my comp is slow and a little overloaded atm
